CHAT.comment: sometimes Mot seems a little uncomfortable with the task , but overall she and Chi are both competent and confident. Chi reads part of VHC (from Saturday page on) aloud before writing. Both Mot and Chi have ideas that are put into the letter. Chi writes in cursive. Except for confirming that she should start with dear Chi doesn't need help with spelling or form. Short and effortless (9:45 but only a few minutes in which letter is written).

u.a: from 0:04 to 1:33 , discussion between EXP , MOT , and Chi about how Chi now lives with her father on the weekdays in Pelham , MA , and with her mother on weekends . EXP records Chi's new address and phone number .
not sure whether she's checking with EXP or recapping for Chi or both
3:49 phone rings . Chi's father is on the phone . Mot , INV , and Chi have a long discussion about Chi's paternal grandfather who has melanoma and was taken to the hospital that morning .
MOT is starting to sound tired
MOT sounds tired and a little impatient

6:43 Mot , INV , and Chi discuss Mot's cabinets which she is planning to stain , and one of which is stained already . Chi asks if Mot knows they are being recorded , and Mot laughs about how because Chi is ten years old , Chi and Mot have short attention spans .
whispers under breath , probably while writing
MOT may be pointing out a hole in Chi's pants
referring to part of the SHELL
MOT seems to be making conversation as Chi writes the letter independently
MOT and EXP are probably watching Meg play with a dryer box or some other action

g.ga: probably referring to Meg not liking the box

u.a: Chi read has instead of had
